title: The designer who doesn't code
excerpt: Blows all, and you don't even know
list1: Do not hide posts on smaller screens — wrap them into a navigation element. This way the resources used to get all posts on the back-end would have been not wasted on the front-end.
Forget the vertical column separator lines. They can't be implemented with current best practices, and they need workaround. Let form follow function even if function is coding standards.
Put that ad elsewhere. Combined with 2.) it's dangerous. Moving out of the grid will spare around half of development time and budget.
list2: Find a designer who code — there are plenty out there. Or
Involve the developer as early as possible in the design process to help the designer with feasibility tips.
Make the developer and designer equal.
